text: Dirk Uipko Stikker, (5 February 1897 - 23 December 1979) was a Dutch banker, industrialist, politician, and diplomat. In 1945, he was among the organizers of the Stichting van de Arbeid (Dutch Labour Foundation), thus helping to lay the foundation of post-war collective bargaining in the Netherlands. Stikker served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 1948 to 1952 and as the third Secretary General of NATO from 1961 to 1964. In 1964, Stikker was awarded an honorary doctorate by Brown University. He died in Wassenaar in 1979, aged 82. ==Other websites== * NATO Declassified - Dirk Stikker (biography) * Sports career Category:1897 births Category:1979 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the Netherlands Category:Dutch businesspeople Category:Ministers of foreign affairs of the Netherlands Category:People's Party for Freedom and Democracy politicians Category:Politicians from Groningen (province) Category:Secretaries General of NATO
title: Dirk Stikker
